reasoning_of_region: The problem involves understanding a passage describing an experiment and selecting the correct option based on that description. The image is not necessary for extracting the required information.
problem_understanding: The problem is about determining which question Linda and Bob's experiment can best answer based on the description of their experiment with the snowboard and wax.

known.name: experiment
known.value: Linda applied wax to snowboard and timed rides

known.name: average time with wax
known.note: Average time for rides with wax

known.name: average time without wax
known.note: Average time for rides without wax

relations: Comparison of average times with and without wax
constraints: The experiment alternates between using wax and not using wax

options.label: A
options.text: Does Linda's snowboard slide down a hill in less time when it has a thin layer of wax or a thick layer of wax?

options.label: B
options.text: Does Linda's snowboard slide down a hill in less time when it has a layer of wax or when it does not have a layer of wax?

reasoning_of_task: The task is to identify which question the experiment is designed to answer based on the description provided.
problem_summary: Linda and Bob conducted an experiment to compare the average time it takes for a snowboard to slide down a hill with and without a layer of wax.

knowns.name: experiment
knowns.value: Linda applied wax to snowboard and timed rides

knowns.name: average time with wax
knowns.note: Average time for rides with wax

knowns.name: average time without wax
knowns.note: Average time for rides without wax

constraints: The experiment alternates between using wax and not using wax
ambiguity: The problem requires understanding which aspect of the experiment is being questioned: presence of wax vs. thickness of wax.
